quizzes.title: History Quiz: Asia and Frog
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, frog, tapir. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the literal translation of the Greek word amphibios, from which the modern word amphibian originated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both kinds of life

questions.question: How many horns does the Indian Rhinoceros, found only in Asia, have on its snout?
To what country is the Rhinoderma rufum, a species of frog from the family Rhinodermatidae, endemic?
What behavior is typical of the Argentine horned frog, also known as Argentine wide-mouthed frog?

options.text: It would eat up anything that comes in its eyesight.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It would eat up anything that comes in its eyesight.

questions.question: Which of these statements is wrong about the Glass frogs from the amphibian family Centrolenidae?

options.text: They are found mainly in Australia and Tasmania.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are found mainly in Australia and Tasmania.

questions.question: What name is used for the enigmatic bovid mammal Kting Voar, which is believed to populate Cambodia and Vietnam in Asia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snake-eating Cow

questions.question: What is the name of the smallest bat species on the planet, endemic to the Asian continent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kittis Hog-nosed Bat

questions.question: What does the diet of the Eastern Tiger Salamander mainly consist of?
What is the favorite food of the Fairy-bluebird, which is found only in Asia?
What animal does the greater siren, a nocturnal amphibian, resemble externally?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An eel

questions.question: What term is used the denote the terrestrial stage of the development of the young newt?
What other interesting name is used commonly to refer to the Purple frog, an amphibian endemic to the Western Ghats in India?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pignose Frog

questions.question: Where does the female Suriname Toad keep its eggs until they develop into young frogs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On its back

questions.question: What sense of the Malayan Tapir, also called Asian Tapir, is underdeveloped?
What interesting characteristic do all amphibians called caecilians share?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They have no legs.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Trilobites and Trilobite
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, places, food. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Did some trilobites filter-feed as a means of obtaining food?
How many orders of trilobite are there?
Which of these statements is true about the reproduction of the Aye-aye?

options.text: The baby stays with its mother for a year.
It reaches reproductive age at 3 - 3.5 years.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What physical feature does the lemur Aye-aye share with rodents, leading to its original classification in order Rodentia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Very large incisors

questions.question: Which of the following is believed to be an ancestor of the trilobites?
What genus and species did the largest complete trilobite fossil ever found belong to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isotelus rex

questions.question: To what geographical region is the Aye-aye indigenous?
Trilobites developed one of the first complex visual systems.
Not all trilobites had eyes.
Which of these statements is true about the lemur Aye-aye?

options.text: It is the second smallest primate on the planet.
It is the second largest primate in the world.
It is the smallest nocturnal primate in the world.
It is the largest nocturnal primate on the planet.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the largest nocturnal primate on the planet.

questions.question: In what places does the nocturnal Aye-aye sleep during the daytime?

options.text: On a branch, covering its body with a big leaf

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On trees

questions.question: Approximately how many species of trilobite existed over the duration of the Paleozoic?
What unusual physical characteristic does the lemur Aye-aye possess?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It has extremely long fingers.

questions.question: What order of trilobite was the only one to survive the Devonian mass extinction?
The pygidium refers to what section of a trilobites body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The tail

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Koala and Koalas
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, infant, koala. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When anxious, the koala produces a loud sound similar to the cry made by this creature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Human baby

questions.question: What unusual anatomical characteristic does the koala possess?

options.text: The make has a bifurcated penis.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about koalas?

options.text: Keeping a koala as a pet is legal in the USA.
They were nearly erased from the planet due to hunting in the early 20th century.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They were nearly erased from the planet due to hunting in the early 20th century.

questions.question: How is the lemur Aye-aye classified according to its diet?
What term is used to refer to the infant koala, as well as to any other baby marsupial?
What does the Greek word Phascolarctos, denoting the genus to which koalas belong, mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pouch bear

questions.question: What does the diet of the koala almost exclusively consist of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eucalyptus leaves

questions.question: What is the literal meaning of the word giraffe considering its Arabic origin?
Where did the name of the Aye-aye originate from according to common hypothesis?

options.text: From the Malagasy expression for I dont know
From the sound made by the animal

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What unique feature do the the fingers of the koala possess?

options.text: There are six fingers on each leg.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They have fingerprints.

questions.question: This fictional koala character, created by author Dorothy Wall, fist appeared in the 1933 book Jacko - the Broadcasting Kookaburra.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blinky Bill

questions.question: The koala is the only animal species on the planet to possess this quality.

options.text: When its hungry, it starts sucking on its tail.
Its brain size is extremely reduced.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its brain size is extremely reduced.

questions.question: To what geographic area is the koala endemic?
What is the name of the Aye-aye character from the 2005 animated comedy movie Madagascar?
What is the Aye-aye traditionally associated with according to ancient Malagasy legends?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Giraffes and Zebras
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, cartoon, zebra. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does the name of the zebra literally mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wild ass

questions.question: The horns of which giraffes are very often bald on top?
This artiodactyl mammal is the closest surviving relative of the giraffe.
Which of these giraffe subspecies is easily distinguished by the very light colored spots on its body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West African Giraffe

questions.question: What is the term denoting a group of zebras that live together?
Unfortunately this fictional dog is constantly bullied by his buddy cat.
What term is used for the behavior exhibited by male giraffes that are engaged in a fight?
Giraffes sometimes use their extremely long blue tongues for this purpose.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cleaning insects from their face

questions.question: What animal is the number one predator of zebras?
Which of these statements is wrong?

options.text: The giraffe is the largest ruminant.
The giraffe is the only surviving member of its family.
The giraffe is the only surviving member of its genus.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The giraffe is the only surviving member of its genus.

questions.question: Which cartoon dog is one of Mickey Mouses best friends?
What method of defense do giraffes most often employ against predator attacks?
Of all mammals, giraffes require the least amount of which of the following?
Which of the senses of zebras is generally underdeveloped and the animal cannot rely very much on it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What is the largest living subspecies of giraffe on the planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Masai Giraffe

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Dog and Insect
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, blattella, bud. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This dog, who first showed up in a Bud Light Beer Super Bowl ad, had a black circle around one eye.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spuds MacKenzie

questions.question: In marine science, ichthyology, branch of zoology closely related to marine biology and oceanography, is the study of what?
What is the real name of the dog who first played the fictitious dog Benji in the series of Benji films?

This member of the oceanic dolphin family, named for its versatile predatory habits, cannot be mistaken with any other sea creature, due to its distinctive coloration - black back, white chest, sides, and a patch above and behind each eye.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Killer whale

questions.question: This dog, whose name means barker in Russian, became the first living creature from Earth to enter orbit.
Periplaneta americana, Blattella germanica and Gromphadorhina portentosa are all species of this insect.
Name the Red Baron hunting Beagle from Charles Schultz popular comic strip, Peanuts.
Devilfish, a large species of ray, also called manta, was named such due to which of these characteristic features?

options.text: Two pointed lobes on each side of the head

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two pointed lobes on each side of the head

questions.question: Many Royal Navy and US Navy ships are named after this fearful insect. Not just that, but an F/A-18 aircraft and a Honda motorcycle also carry its name.
Which of these is the most distinctive feature of one of the largest marine creatures, which is also known to be the best diver - the sperm whale?

options.text: The unique curvatures of its fins

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its enormous head

questions.question: Which Rough Collie was awarded a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame?
This cartoon Great Dane often needs his nephew headstrong nephew to protect him.
It is the national insect of Canada and the state insect of Texas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monarch butterfly

questions.question: Giant squids, for long believed to be mythical creatures, are a type of deep-ocean dwelling squid that can grow to a tremendous size. The giant squid also holds the record for the largest organ, in which of these bodily systems?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Visual system

questions.question: In Herman Melvilles Moby-Dick, the leading character Ahab, consumed with the desire for revenge for his lost leg, mindlessly pursues a whale nicknamed Moby Dick. What type of whale is Moby Dick, according to the book?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sperm whale

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Komodo Dragon and Bears
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, bears, following. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Komodo Dragon is venomous.
How heavy was the largest verified wild Komodo Dragon?
The Komodo Dragon is NOT native to which of these islands?
Which of the following is not a nickname for a polar bear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great bear

questions.question: How many years does a mother grizzly stay with her cubs?

options.text: 1and a half to 3 and a half years

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1and a half to 3 and a half years

questions.question: At what age can grizzly bears start to mate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4 and a half year

questions.question: The scarab, a sacred beetle to Ancient Egyptians, is commonly known as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dung Beetle

questions.question: What is the top speed that a Komodo Dragon can reach?
What is the common length of a full grown male Komodo Dragon?
The Komodo Dragon is only one of 3 species of venomous lizards in the world.
Are all bears omnivores?
How fast can a black bear run?
Which of these American zoos does NOT house Komodo Dragons?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bronx Zoo

questions.question: Do polar bears live in Antarctica?
Female Komodo Dragons can lay eggs without any contact with males.
